Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the system log, I see a sequence of events across different applications: Microsoft Word, Google Chrome, Adobe Acrobat, and Microsoft Excel. The user seems to be working on multiple documents over time.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The user seems to be working on a Quarterly Report project. They start with Quarterly_Report.docx, then work on Document1.docx (which might be a draft), then handle email, then look at a PDF report, then work on Excel budget, then update Document1.docx with budget references, and finally complete Quarterly_Report.docx. So probably one big case for the entire session?

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: In process mining, a case is often defined by a users intent or a logical unit. Here, since the user is working on the quarterly report, I think the entire sequence from 08:59:50 to 09:08:15 is one case.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For activity naming: I need to convert low-level actions to high-level activities. FOCUS Open Document, TYPING Type Text, SAVE Save Document, SWITCH Switch Application, CLICK Open Email or Reply to Email, SCROLL Scroll Document, HIGHLIGHT Highlight Text.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The email is about the annual meeting, which is related to the quarterly report. So its part of the same process. The entire session is part of preparing the quarterly report, so its one case.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I think this covers all events. Now, for the case ID: Since the user is working on a single project (the quarterly report) without clear case boundaries (e.g., no start/end of case), Ill assign one case ID Case_001 to all events.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Activity names are high-level: Open Document for FOCUS, Type Text for TYPING, Save Document for SAVE, etc. The SWITCH events are represented as Switch Application with context attributes to indicate the app transition.
